t: The*pn Lord*s is my light and my salvation— whom*ld shall I fear? The*ln Lord*s is the stronghold of my life— of*ld whom shall I be afraid?
When*pn the wicked advance against me to*ld devour me, it*ln is my enemies and my foes who*ld will stumble and fall.
Though*ln an army besiege me, my*ld heart will not fear; though*ln war break out against me, even*ld then I will be confident.

One*pn thing I ask from the Lord,*s this*ld only do I seek: that*ln I may dwell in the house of the Lord*s all*ld the days of my life, to*ln gaze on the beauty of the Lord*s and*ld to seek him in his temple.
For*ln in the day of trouble he*ld will keep me safe in his dwelling; he*ln will hide me in the shelter of his sacred tent and*ld set me high upon a rock.
Then*pn my head will be exalted above*ld the enemies who surround me; at*ln his sacred tent I will sacrifice with shouts of joy; I*ld will sing and make music to the Lord.*s
Hear*pn my voice when I call, Lord;*s be*ld merciful to me and answer me.
My*ln heart says of you, “Seek his face!” Your*ld face, Lord,*s I will seek.
Do*ln not hide your face from me, do*ld not turn your servant away in anger; you*ld have been my helper. Do*ln not reject me or forsake me, God*ld my Savior.
Though*ln my father and mother forsake me, the*ld Lord*s will receive me.
Teach*ln me your way, Lord;*s lead*ld me in a straight path because*ld of my oppressors.
Do*ln not turn me over to the desire of my foes, for*ld false witnesses rise up against me, spouting*ld malicious accusations.
I*pn remain confident of this: I*ld will see the goodness of the Lord*s in*ld the land of the living.
Wait*ln for the Lord;*s be*ld strong and take heart and*ld wait for the Lord.*s
